result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael Robert Meck

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Order filed in 13CV334, copied to related files.

Defendant Michael Robert Meck in court with attorney Mark Drew Biller. Kenneth N Sortedahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  JB-clerk 1:23pm       CASES: 13CF242/13CV334/14CF56. No victims. All parties recd PSI. Off the record 1:24pm  Back on the record 1:31pm. Atty Biller - no corrections/errors. State - no corrections/errors. Atty Biller addresses CT w/argument. State gives argument. CIP not elg/SA elg. No firearms/body armor, can not vote until civil rights are restored, no holding public office, if no US citizen may face deportation. Not eligible for expungement. 

13CF242: Count 1 & 2 - W/H sent,  up to 18 months prob-sign up today, prob can ask for early discharge and CT will consider, compas eval and follow through, no illegal substances on prob, DNA sample - no surcharge, 75hrs CS during probation (50hrs first yr/25 hrs 6 mo), $290.60 for each conviction and come out of money held in 13CV334 (in PCSD) - send assessment fee to PCHS for assessment, remainder to be forfeited. adj 2:03pm
Sentencing hearing on October 17, 2014 at 01:00 pm.

CASES: 13CF242, 13CV334 & 14CF56. Defendant Michael Robert Meck in court with attorney Mark Drew Biller.  Daniel P. Steffen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  CW-clerk 8:49 am.  
Cannot possess firearms, cannot vote until civil rights restored, cannot possess body armor, if not US citizen face deportation, cannot hold public office.
13CF242-Count 1-guilty.  Count 2-guilty.  CT-accept pleas, adj guilty on both counts.  Counts 3 & 4 - DRI for sentencing.  14CF56-DRI for sentencing & possible rest.  13CV334-accept Judgment entered in favor of state - will set for review at sentencing.  PSI-longform, COMPAS, PSI due 10/3/14.  Agent need not be present.  13CV344 for status on 10/17/14. Bond cont.  9:21 am adj.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 17, 2014 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Michael Robert Meck in court with attorney Mark D Biller.  Stephen C Dorrance appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  BAM clerk - 09:18 am - JA to schedule for JT w/Analyst.  Bond continues.  Adj 9:21 am
Scheduling conference on May 2, 2014 at 09:15 am.
Plea of Not Guilty and Defense Motions
